lines.content: * Your very own Personal Assistant Chatbot. Use Cbot to keep track of your tasks,
* from deadlines to events, and even mark them as you complete them!
* @param filePath Directory location (relative) of the save file.
* @throws IOException If the save file cannot be read.
* Starts up Cbot to be used.
* @throws IOException If the save file cannot be accessed.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Signals that the user input was improper, and likely erroneous.
* Constructs a BadInputException with the specified detail message.
* A command type accepted by Cbot.
/** Displays the current list of tasks. */
/** Marks the stipulated task as done. */
/** Catches MARK calls with no input. */
/** Marks the stipulated task as not done. */
/** Catches UNMARK calls with no input. */
/** Deletes the stipulated task from the list. */
/** Catches DELETE calls with no input. */
/** Adds a To-Do task to the list. */
/** Catches TODO calls with no input. */
/** Adds a Deadline task to the list. */
/** Catches DEADLINE calls with no input. */
/** Adds an Event task to the list. */
/** Catches EVENT calls with no input. */
/** Sorts the list by date and description. */
/** Displays the tasks that fall before the given date. */
/** Catches BEFORE calls with no input. */
/** Displays the tasks that fall after the given date. */
/** Catches AFTER calls with no input. */
/** Displays the tasks that match the given filter. */
/** Catches FILTER calls with no input. */
/** Displays the tasks that contain the input. */
/** Catches FIND calls with no input. */
* Constructs a Command type with the given keyword.
* Specifies whether the Command expects additional input after the keyword,
* and whether the file needs to be saved after the Command is run.
* @param hasText Whether more text after the keyword is expected.
* @param save Whether the file needs to be saved after the command is run.
Command(String str, boolean hasText, boolean save) {
* Constructs a Command type with the given keyword, where the Command does not update the file.
* Allows to specify whether the Command expects additional input after the keyword.
* @param hasText Whether more text after the keyword is expected.
* Returns true if the Command updates the list of tasks, thus calling for it to be saved.
* @return Whether the Command warrants a file save.
* Returns the length of the keyword, including any whitespace after.
* @return The length of the Command keyword.
* Returns true if the start of the given String matches the Command keyword.
* e.g. "mark 1" matches the keyword "mark " in MARK.
* @return Whether the text means to call this Command.
* Extracts the body of the input. That is, the text that comes after the Command keyword.
* Returns true if the Command expects body text but receives none.
* e.g. "mark  " with no task number specified.
* @param text The body text to check.
* @return Whether there is missing body text, given the Command type.
* Constructs a new instance to manage the save file at the given path.
* @param path Directory location (relative) of the save file.
* Returns true if the file already exists.
* Creates the parent file and the save file itself, if either or both do not yet exist.
* @throws IOException If the save file cannot be accessed.
* Writes the current state of the TaskList to the save file.
* @throws IOException If the save file cannot be accessed.
public void saveFile(TaskList tl) throws IOException {
* Reads and loads the save file as a list of tasks.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the save file does not exist in the expected location.
// type SEP done SEP desc SEP due/from SEP to
* Handles much of the parsing of user inputs.
* Constructs a new instance to process the user's current input. Attempts to recognize the Command,
* and the rest of the input body.
* @throws PoorInputException If the input command is not recognized.
throw new PoorInputException("Sorry, I don't recognize that command :<");
* Returns true if the stored Command is the BYE Command.
* @return true if the stored Command is BYE.
* Returns true if the stored Command requires the task list to be saved.
* @return Whether the task list needs to be saved after the Command.
* Processes the Command and the rest of the input. If needed, the TaskList is modified and the UI is given
* outputs to print. The main bulk of Cbot's parsing is done here.
* @param tl The current list of tasks.
* @throws PoorInputException If the input text is improper or erroneous.
* @throws DateTimeParseException If some provided datetime is not in a recognized format.
public void respond(TaskList tl) throws PoorInputException, DateTimeParseException {
throw new PoorInputException("That command needs an input");
throw new BadInputException("Hey! You have to start *before* you end...");
throw new PoorInputException("You have no tasks to sort :P");
UI.say("Okay! I've sorted your tasks by date:");
throw new PoorInputException("Eh? You have no tasks to filter");
UI.say("You don't have any tasks before " + this.text);
UI.say("Here are your tasks before " + this.text + ":");
throw new PoorInputException("Eh? You have no tasks to filter");
UI.say("You don't have any tasks after " + this.text);
UI.say("Here are your tasks after " + this.text + ":");
throw new PoorInputException("Eh? You have no tasks to filter");
msg = "Ok! These are on your ToDo list:";
msg = "Ok! Here are the Tasks you've completed:";
msg = "Ok! Here are the Tasks you haven't completed yet:";
throw new PoorInputException("I'm not sure what Task type that is :(");
UI.say("You don't have any of those :/");
throw new PoorInputException("Eh? You have no tasks to filter");
throw new PoorInputException("That command needs an input");
* Signals that the user input was improper.
* Constructs a PoorInputException with the specified detail message.
* Manages printing to and receiving from the user, mainly via the Command Line Interface.
private static final String ERROR     = WARNING + "<Error> ";
private static final String PROMPT    = "\n v v\n";

private static final String STALL     = "
   o
   o
   o

";
* Constructs a new instance to manage the CLI.
* Prompts the user to input text and receives it.
* @throws BadInputException If the input includes the separator string used by the save file.
throw new BadInputException("Please avoid using: \"" + Task.SEP + "\"");
* Prints that a new save file has been created.
* @param path Directory location (relative) of the save file.
System.out.println(WARNING + "No save file found. Making a new save at " + path);
System.out.println(STALL + INDENT + "Hey! D:< I'm not\n" + dukeLogo);
* Prints the given exception as a soft warning.
* Prints the given exception as a warning.
* Prints a suggestion for formatting datetime. This is usually raised
* when the user provides an unrecognized datetime format.
System.out.println(ERROR + "Sorry, I don't know how to interpret that datetime");
System.out.println(WARNING + "Try something in the form: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm");
* Prints the given String with the standard indentation.
* Prints a list of strings, such that each is indented properly.
* @param arr The list of strings to print.
* Task with a due date. Stores the description of the task, whether it has been completed or not,
* Constructs a task with the given description, completion status, and deadline.
* @param isDone Whether the task is done.
* @param due The deadline of the task.
public Deadline(String desc, boolean isDone, LocalDateTime due) {
* Constructs a not-yet-done task with the given description and deadline.
* @param due The deadline of the task.
* Task with a start and end time. Stores the description of the task, whether it has been completed or not,
* Constructs a task with the given description, completion status, start datetime, and end datetime.
* @param isDone Whether the task is done.
public Event(String desc, boolean isDone, LocalDateTime fromTime, LocalDateTime toTime) {
* Constructs a not-yet-done task with the given description, start datetime, and end datetime.
public Event(String desc, LocalDateTime fromTime, LocalDateTime toTime) {
* Default (To-Do) task. Stores the description of the task, and whether it has been completed or not.
* Constructs a 'to-do' task with the given description and completion status.
* @param isDone Whether the task is done.
* Constructs a not-yet-done 'to-do' task with the given description.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the symbol corresponding to the task type.
* "T" for To-Do, "D" for Deadline, and "E" for Event.
* Returns the symbol corresponding to the task's completion status.
* "X" for done/marked, and whitespace (" ") for not-yet-done/unmarked.
* Returns true if the task has a time attached to it (Deadline, Event), and false otherwise (To-Do).
* Returns the 'main' datetime of the task. i.e. the due date of a Deadline, and the start of an Event.
* Returns the earliest supported datetime (LocalDateTime.MIN) for non-time-based (To-Do) tasks.
* Returns the string representation of the task, to be displayed for a user.
* This provides its type, status, description, and time (if applicable).
* @return The string representation of the task, for reading.
* Returns the string representation of the task, to be saved in a file.
* This provides its type, status, description, and time (if applicable).
* @return The string representation of the task, for saving.
* @return Whether the status changed from not done to done.
* @return Whether the status changed from done to not done.
* Compares this task with the other task.
* Tasks are first compared by time (i.e. {@link #getTime()}, then lexicographically.
* @param other The task to be compared to.
* @return A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this is less than, equal to, or greater than the other.
* Stores and manages a list of tasks.
* Constructs an empty list of tasks.
* Constructs a (special) list of the given tasks.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Returns an enumerated list of the tasks stored.
* Returns a list of the tasks stored filtered by the given clause.
* Tasks are numbered relative to their position entire list, not the filtered list.
* @param pred The clause a task must satisfy to be included.
* Returns true if the input number is larger than the number of tasks, or less than one.
* @param num The input number to test.
* @return Whether the number is more than the number of tasks, or less than one.
* Returns a different message depending on whether the input number is
* less than one, more than the number of tasks or else within the acceptable range.
* @param num The input number to test.
return "Hm, you don't have that many tasks!";
return "All's good! That index is in range :D";
* Marks the task at the given position as done.
* @param num The 1-based index of the task.
* Marks the task at the given position as not done.
* @param num The 1-based index of the task.
return "Hm, you haven't yet done:\n" + GAP
* Removes the task at the given position from the list.
* @param num The 1-based index of the task.
* Sorts the list of tasks. From earliest to latest, then lexicographically.
* Returns a string representation of the entire TaskList, for the convenience of file-saving.
* @return A string representation of the TaskList, for saving.
* Manages text-datetime translation. Reads text (into datetime), and writes datetime (into text).
private static final String[] D_FORMS = {"y-M-d", "d/M/y", "d MMM y", "MMM d y"};
private static final String[] T_FORMS = {" Hmm", " H:m",
" ha", " h a", " h.ma", " h.m a", " h:ma", " h:m a"};
private static final DateTimeFormatter UI_FORM = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd/MM/yy, HHmm");
* Parses a given text into datetime. Has a set pool of accepted formats, including (but
* not limited to) "yyyy-MM-DD HHmm", "d/M/y H:m", and "MMM d y".
* @param dtStr The text to be parsed.
* @throws DateTimeParseException If dtStr is not in a recognized format.
public static LocalDateTime parseDT(String dtStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Writes datetime in the "dd/MM/yy, HHmm" format.

Deadline dl2 = new Deadline("test 2", true, LocalDateTime.parse("0023-01-27T10:00"));
Event e1 = new Event("test 1", LocalDateTime.MIN, LocalDateTime.MAX);

assertEquals(tlFive.rangeError(6), "Hm, you don't have that many tasks!");
assertEquals(tlFive.rangeError(3), "All's good! That index is in range :D");
